description.narrative: The IRRF is UNDP’s results framework to monitor and report on its achievements against the Strategic Plan 2014-2017. UNDP publishes country level IRRF results that UNDP’s projects contributed to
number of new full-time equivalent jobs created for women 15+ years old
number of new full-time equivalent jobs created for men 15+ years old
total number of new full-time equivalent jobs created
number of additional females benefitting from UNDP's livelihoods interventions
number of additional males benefitting from UNDP's livelihoods interventions
number of additional people benefitting from UNDP's livelihoods interventions

Strengthening Capacity for Environmental Sustainability and Climate Change.

title.narrative: Environment Sustainability & Climate Change Project Document

description.narrative: The IRRF is UNDP’s results framework to monitor and report on its achievements against the Strategic Plan 2014-2017. UNDP publishes country level IRRF results that UNDP’s projects contributed to

Total number of disaster risk reduction and/or integrated disaster risk reduction and adaptation plans, and dedicated institutional frameworks and multi-stakeholder coordination mechanisms, are in place

Number of disaster risk reduction and/or integrated disaster risk reduction and adaptation plans, and dedicated institutional frameworks and multi-stakeholder coordination mechanisms, which are gender responsive
total number of legislative or regulatory provisions for DRM (including CRM)
number of legislative or regulatory provisions for DRM (including CRM) that are effective
Capacity development through establishment of national frameworks for environment and climate change integration as well as risk mainstreaming.
capital of a political entity
Social Protection, Land Housing and Community Amenities - disaster prevention and preparedness

1. National Climate Change Strategy and Action Plan in place by 2013 2. National Climate Change Policy in place by 2014 3. Number of community resilience initaitives supported: National Disaster Simulation Excercise, World Disaster Day etc 4. Number of national capacity building intiatives for enhanced management and monitoring of natural resources.

comment.narrative: 1. Limited enabling environment for national climate change undertaking: no national frameworks or ingration of climate change into sectoral approches. 2. Disaster risk management not promoted fully: limited resources. 3. Limited capacity to manage natural resources sustainably.

1. National capacities through enhanced frameworks for climate change management: draft Climate Change Bill; National Adaptation Plan (if resources are available). 2. Sustainable Energy for ALL Investment Prospectus and Actions Agenda (IP-AA) for an engaged national stakeholders for increased uptake of renewable energy production and private sector involvement. 3. Two 'waste for jobs' pilot schemes in place. 4. Increased national and local capacities for disaster risk management: 5 local governments contingency plans; national standard operating procedures.

1. The 2015 Climate Change Policy was approved. Continued to support an enabling environment for institutionalization of climate change in the country leading to the endorsement for the development of the Climate Change Bill (IRRF 1.4.2): draft in place. Supported national participation (two national participants) to the UNFCCC COP 22, where the country promulgated the National Climate Change Policy at Marrakech, Morocco and CBD COP-MOP in Cancun Mexico (one participant). The media-connect led to establishment of a partnership to create better awareness on the SDGs and Climate Change.
The development of the National Adaptation Plan (NAP) could not be supported because of lack of resources.
2. The Sustainable Energy for ALL Investment Prospectus and Actions Agenda (IP-AA) was finalized and approved by the Cabinet and serves as a reference instrument for the development of the Renewable Energy interventions. The IP-AA is also informing the collaboration with IRENA in support to the country for the development of the Swaziland Energy Master Plan (IRRF 1.4.2)
3. The ‘waste for jobs’ pilot was secured working under the Local Development Economy initiative. Out of the 45 homeless individuals salvaging the Matsapha landfill 10 were recruited and capacitated to become waste ‘Reclaimers’ working at the Matsapha Industrial Site Landfill. These participants received training and equipment to recover material and recycle. The municipality is exploring market for the products (IRRF 1.3.2).
4. No support was provided in this regard as the CO prioritized support to the El Nino drought emergency coordination.

1. Improved waste management capacities at national and local levels: Waste Management Indaba Report dissemination: Number of Matsapha landfill Waste Reclaimers trained in waste recycling; Matsapha Town Council Waste Management Policy draft. 2. National climate change frameworks status improved: Climate Change Bill. 3. National Adaptation Plan developed

1. Improved uptake of waste management practices at local levels leading to the dissemination of the Waste Management Indaba Report, training of 37 Matsapha landfill Waste Reclaimers on waste recycling and product development. The Matsapha Town Council drafted the Waste Management Policy. 2. The National Climate Change Bill was not developed due to re-prioritization by the Ministry of Tourism and Environmental Affairs. 3. National Adaptation Plan was not developed because of lack of resources.

1. Access to climate finance increased for the country: GEF Round 6 Project Identification Form on Ecosystems rehabilitation developed and submitted to the GEF Council for approval: GEF Round 7 focal area prioritization process initiated. 2. National analytic and strategic capacities for renewable energy rural incentives enhanced: Programme for Renewable Energy in Swaziland (PARES) developed through partnerships; MOU with the University of New-York for partnerships in research 3. Improved waste management capacities at national and local levels Matsapha Town Council Waste Management Policy developed. 4. Increased governance capacities for national disaster risk management: Amendment of the 2006 Disaster Management Act; National Response Standard Operating Procedures for disaster risk management; National Risk Assessment Report; Finalization of the Multi-Hazard Contingency Plan (MHCP).

description.narrative: To strengthen the management effectiveness of the Protected Area system of Swaziland to ensure a viable set of representative samples of the country’s full range of natural ecosystems are conserved, through a network of PAs.
